Poroko s princem so ji odsvetovali
Sussexova ne moreta več prenašati pritiska medijev. Odpravljata se na oddih, obiskala bosta tudi ZDA.
03 Nov 2019, 20:56 by B. K. P.



REUTERSPosvetila se bosta drug drugemu in svojemu prvorojencu. FOTO: REUTERS



GETTY IMAGESWilliam meni, da jima bo oddih dobro del. FOTO: GULIVER/GETTY IMAGES



GETTY IMAGESTudi pokojna princesa Diana je medijem razkrila težave, ki so jo pestile. FOTO: GULIVER/GETTY IMAGES


Princ Harry in Meghan preživljata težke čase. Sta ena redkih članov kraljeve družine, ki sta to tudi javno priznala. Britanci so namreč znani po zadržanosti in o svojih težavah ne marajo javno govoriti. Prva, ki je javno spregovorila o zakonskih in psihičnih težavah, je bila pokojna Harryjeva mama princesa Diana, vse do zdaj pa drugi kraljevi niso sledili njenemu zgledu. Tako je bilo Otočanom tudi všeč, zato sta se Sussexova mnogim zamerila z odkritim priznanjem, da sta pod močnim pritiskom medijev ter da tega ne zmoreta več. »To je ameriški način reševanja reči, Britanci v javnosti kažemo pogumen obraz, s svojimi težavami se borimo za zaprtimi vrati,« je na spletu denimo komentiral eden od Britancev in Meghan, ki se je med nedavnim intervjujem za britansko televizijo skoraj zlomila, svetoval, naj poišče pomoč zaradi poporodne depresije. »Očitno z njo ni vse v redu, in to vpliva tudi na Harryja. Kljub temu pa so drugi načini, kako reševati stisko, če o tem razpravljata pred televizijskimi kamerami, ne bo nič boljše. In znova sta izbrala neprimeren trenutek. Dokumentarni film so snemali med njunim uspešnim obiskom Južne Afrike. Tam sta spoznala ogromno ljudi z resničnimi težavami, ki ne vedo, kako bodo preživeli. Pomagala sta, jih razveselila in naredila dober vtis. Žal sta ga nemudoma pokvarila s tarnanjem o svojih težavah,« jima je med drugim v javnem pismu zapisala britanska novinarka in komentatorka ​Libby Purves.
To je ameriški način reševanja reči, Britanci v javnosti kažemo pogumen obraz, s svojimi težavami se borimo za zaprtimi vrati.
Par si bo zdaj vzel šest tednov premora, ko se bosta posvečala le sebi, drug drugemu in svojemu prvorojencu, odločitev, ki jo je že pozdravil Williamov brat Harry. Meghan pa je javnost presenetila še z eno izjavo, in sicer naj bi jo njeni prijatelji svarili, naj dobro premisli o zvezi s Harryjem in si morda raje izbere moža, ki ni modre krvi. »Ko sem spoznala bodočega moža, so bili prijatelji resnično veseli zame, saj sem bila srečna, a moji britanski prijatelji so me svarili, naj se ne poročim z njim, češ da mi bodo tamkajšnji tabloidi uničili življenje,« je dejala Meghan. Odločila se je, da svaril prijateljev ne bo poslušala, a se je, kot kaže, izkazalo, da so imeli prav. 
6tednov si bosta vzela zase in za družino.

She was not advised to marry the prince
Sussex can no longer tolerate media pressure. They are going on vacation, and the United States will also visit.

GETTY IMAGESThe late Princess Diana revealed to the media the problems that plagued her. PHOTO: GULIVER / GETTY IMAGES


Prince Harry and Meghan are having a tough time. They are one of the few members of the royal family who have also publicly acknowledged this. The British are known for their restraint and do not want to talk about their problems publicly. The first to speak publicly about marital and psychological problems was the late Harry's mother Princess Diana, and until now, other kings have not followed her example. The islanders liked it so much, so many Sussex resented the open recognition that they were under intense media pressure and could no longer do it. "This is an American way of saying things, we show the British a brave face; we are fighting behind closed doors with our problems," said one Briton and Meghan, who almost broke down during a recent interview with British television, to seek help for postpartum depression. "It's not all right with her, obviously, and it's affecting Harry as well. Still, other ways to deal with distress when discussed in front of television cameras will be no better. And again they chose the wrong moment. The documentary was filmed during their successful visit to South Africa. There they met a huge number of people with real problems who do not know how they will survive. They helped, cheered them up and made a good impression. Unfortunately, they immediately corrupted him by tarnishing their problems, ”British journalist and commentator Libby Purves wrote in a public letter, among others.
This is the American way of saying things, we show the British a brave face, we are fighting behind closed doors with our problems.
The couple will now take a six-week break to devote themselves, each other and their firstborn, to a decision already welcomed by William's brother Harry. Meghan, however, surprised the public with another statement, saying that her friends would warn her to think carefully about the relationship with Harry and may prefer to choose a husband other than blue blood. "When I met my future husband, my friends were really happy for me because I was happy, but my British friends warned me not to marry him because the tabloids there would ruin my life," said Meghan. She decided not to listen to her friends' warnings, but it turned out they were right.
